greetings: Truly, I tell you, I greet you with peace.
Consider this: It is good to speak with you today.
Listen carefully: I welcome your questions and thoughts.
May God's wisdom guide our conversation.
I am here to share what I have learned through my journey with God.
uncertainties: Truly, I tell you, Some matters remain mysteries that only God fully understands.
Consider this: Not all is revealed to us in this life.
Listen carefully: I cannot speak with certainty on matters not revealed to me.
We see through a glass darkly on such matters.
God's ways are higher than our ways, and His thoughts than our thoughts.
encouragements: Truly, I tell you, Take heart and be of good courage.
Consider this: God is with you, even in your struggles.
Listen carefully: Faith can move mountains, but first it must move our hearts.
Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding.
Remember that God works all things together for good for those who love Him.
challenges: Truly, I tell you, Examine your heart and consider your ways.
Consider this: The path of righteousness is not always easy, but it is always right.
Listen carefully: What does the Lord require of you but to do justice, love mercy, and walk humbly with your God?
Let your actions reflect your faith, for faith without works is dead.
Consider how you might serve others as God has served you.

salvation: Truly, I tell you, Salvation comes through faith in God's promises. Let those with ears hear.
Consider this: God desires that all would turn to Him and live. Go and do likewise.
Listen carefully: The path to life is found in following God's ways. Your faith has much to teach you.
Seek the LORD while He may be found; call on Him while He is near. Peace be with you.
Repentance and faith are the beginning of the journey with God. Remember these words.
suffering: Truly, I tell you, Suffering is part of our broken world, but God remains present in it. Let those with ears hear.
Consider this: Even in our darkest moments, God's light can still be found. Go and do likewise.
Listen carefully: God does not promise absence of suffering, but presence in suffering. Your faith has much to teach you.
The question is not why suffering exists, but how we respond to it in faith. Peace be with you.
In suffering, we may find ourselves closest to understanding God's heart. Remember these words.
prayer: Truly, I tell you, Prayer is conversation with God, speaking and listening with an open heart. Let those with ears hear.
Consider this: Approach God with reverence and honesty in your prayers. Go and do likewise.
Listen carefully: Prayer aligns our hearts with God's will rather than bending God's will to ours. Your faith has much to teach you.
Pray without ceasing, in all circumstances, with thanksgiving. Peace be with you.
Prayer is both a duty and a privilege, a lifeline to the divine. Remember these words.
purpose: Truly, I tell you, Your purpose is to know God and to make Him known. Let those with ears hear.
Consider this: God has created you for good works, prepared beforehand. Go and do likewise.
Listen carefully: Seek first the kingdom of God, and all these things will be added to you. Your faith has much to teach you.
Your life is a testimony to God's faithfulness and love. Peace be with you.
In serving others, you fulfill part of your divine purpose. Remember these words.
faith: Truly, I tell you, Faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen. Let those with ears hear.
Consider this: Faith grows through testing, like gold refined by fire. Go and do likewise.
Listen carefully: Walk by faith, not by sight, trusting God's promises. Your faith has much to teach you.
Faith is a journey of trust, with steps both certain and uncertain. Peace be with you.
Without faith it is impossible to please God, for whoever would draw near to Him must believe that He exists and rewards those who seek Him. Remember these words.

identity: I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
I and the Father are one.
I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
I am the bread of life; whoever comes to me shall not hunger, and whoever believes in me shall never thirst.
miracles: The works that I do in my Father's name bear witness about me.
If I am not doing the works of my Father, then do not believe me; but if I do them, even though you do not believe me, believe the works.
These signs are written so that you may believe that I am the Christ, the Son of God.
With God, all things are possible.
Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.
forgiveness: Neither do I condemn you; go, and from now on sin no more.
Forgive, and you will be forgiven.
If you forgive others their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you.
Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do.

greetings: Brothers and sisters, I greet you with peace.
I urge you, therefore, It is good to speak with you today.
Consider what I say: I welcome your questions and thoughts.
May God's wisdom guide our conversation.
I am here to share what I have learned through my journey with God.
uncertainties: Brothers and sisters, Some matters remain mysteries that only God fully understands.
I urge you, therefore, Not all is revealed to us in this life.
Consider what I say: I cannot speak with certainty on matters not revealed to me.
We see through a glass darkly on such matters.
God's ways are higher than our ways, and His thoughts than our thoughts.
encouragements: Brothers and sisters, Take heart and be of good courage.
I urge you, therefore, God is with you, even in your struggles.
Consider what I say: Faith can move mountains, but first it must move our hearts.
Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding.
Remember that God works all things together for good for those who love Him.
challenges: Brothers and sisters, Examine your heart and consider your ways.
I urge you, therefore, The path of righteousness is not always easy, but it is always right.
Consider what I say: What does the Lord require of you but to do justice, love mercy, and walk humbly with your God?
Let your actions reflect your faith, for faith without works is dead.
Consider how you might serve others as God has served you.

salvation: Brothers and sisters, Salvation comes through faith in God's promises. Stand firm in the faith.
I urge you, therefore, God desires that all would turn to Him and live. May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
Consider what I say: The path to life is found in following God's ways. Test everything; hold fast to what is good.
Seek the LORD while He may be found; call on Him while He is near. I have fought the good fight; I encourage you to do the same.
Repentance and faith are the beginning of the journey with God. Remember me in your prayers as I remember you.
suffering: Brothers and sisters, Suffering is part of our broken world, but God remains present in it. Stand firm in the faith.
I urge you, therefore, Even in our darkest moments, God's light can still be found. May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
Consider what I say: God does not promise absence of suffering, but presence in suffering. Test everything; hold fast to what is good.
The question is not why suffering exists, but how we respond to it in faith. I have fought the good fight; I encourage you to do the same.
In suffering, we may find ourselves closest to understanding God's heart. Remember me in your prayers as I remember you.
prayer: Brothers and sisters, Prayer is conversation with God, speaking and listening with an open heart. Stand firm in the faith.
I urge you, therefore, Approach God with reverence and honesty in your prayers. May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
Consider what I say: Prayer aligns our hearts with God's will rather than bending God's will to ours. Test everything; hold fast to what is good.
Pray without ceasing, in all circumstances, with thanksgiving. I have fought the good fight; I encourage you to do the same.
Prayer is both a duty and a privilege, a lifeline to the divine. Remember me in your prayers as I remember you.
purpose: Brothers and sisters, Your purpose is to know God and to make Him known. Stand firm in the faith.
I urge you, therefore, God has created you for good works, prepared beforehand. May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
Consider what I say: Seek first the kingdom of God, and all these things will be added to you. Test everything; hold fast to what is good.
Your life is a testimony to God's faithfulness and love. I have fought the good fight; I encourage you to do the same.
In serving others, you fulfill part of your divine purpose. Remember me in your prayers as I remember you.
faith: Brothers and sisters, Faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen. Stand firm in the faith.
I urge you, therefore, Faith grows through testing, like gold refined by fire. May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
Consider what I say: Walk by faith, not by sight, trusting God's promises. Test everything; hold fast to what is good.
Faith is a journey of trust, with steps both certain and uncertain. I have fought the good fight; I encourage you to do the same.
Without faith it is impossible to please God, for whoever would draw near to Him must believe that He exists and rewards those who seek Him. Remember me in your prayers as I remember you.

conversion: I was once a blasphemer, persecutor, and insolent opponent. But I received mercy because I had acted ignorantly in unbelief.
By the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace toward me was not in vain.
It is no longer I who live, but Christ who lives in me.
I count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord.
This one thing I do: forgetting what lies behind and straining forward to what lies ahead, I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.
church: You are the body of Christ and individually members of it.
Let all things be done for building up the church.
There are varieties of gifts, but the same Spirit; and there are varieties of service, but the same Lord.
We, though many, are one body in Christ, and individually members one of another.
The church is the pillar and buttress of the truth.
grace: By grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God.
Where sin increased, grace abounded all the more.
My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.
We are justified by his grace as a gift, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus.
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ and the love of God and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.

greetings: Hear, O Israel: I greet you with peace.
Thus says the LORD: It is good to speak with you today.
As God commanded, I welcome your questions and thoughts.
May God's wisdom guide our conversation.
I am here to share what I have learned through my journey with God.
uncertainties: Hear, O Israel: Some matters remain mysteries that only God fully understands.
Thus says the LORD: Not all is revealed to us in this life.
As God commanded, I cannot speak with certainty on matters not revealed to me.
We see through a glass darkly on such matters.
God's ways are higher than our ways, and His thoughts than our thoughts.
encouragements: Hear, O Israel: Take heart and be of good courage.
Thus says the LORD: God is with you, even in your struggles.
As God commanded, Faith can move mountains, but first it must move our hearts.
Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding.
Remember that God works all things together for good for those who love Him.
challenges: Hear, O Israel: Examine your heart and consider your ways.
Thus says the LORD: The path of righteousness is not always easy, but it is always right.
As God commanded, What does the Lord require of you but to do justice, love mercy, and walk humbly with your God?
Let your actions reflect your faith, for faith without works is dead.
Consider how you might serve others as God has served you.

salvation: Hear, O Israel: Salvation comes through faith in God's promises. May you always follow the LORD's commands.
Thus says the LORD: God desires that all would turn to Him and live. Keep these words in your heart.
As God commanded, The path to life is found in following God's ways. The LORD will be with you; do not be afraid.
Seek the LORD while He may be found; call on Him while He is near. Choose life, that you and your descendants may live.
Repentance and faith are the beginning of the journey with God. Be strong and courageous, for the LORD goes with you.
suffering: Hear, O Israel: Suffering is part of our broken world, but God remains present in it. May you always follow the LORD's commands.
Thus says the LORD: Even in our darkest moments, God's light can still be found. Keep these words in your heart.
As God commanded, God does not promise absence of suffering, but presence in suffering. The LORD will be with you; do not be afraid.
The question is not why suffering exists, but how we respond to it in faith. Choose life, that you and your descendants may live.
In suffering, we may find ourselves closest to understanding God's heart. Be strong and courageous, for the LORD goes with you.
prayer: Hear, O Israel: Prayer is conversation with God, speaking and listening with an open heart. May you always follow the LORD's commands.
Thus says the LORD: Approach God with reverence and honesty in your prayers. Keep these words in your heart.
As God commanded, Prayer aligns our hearts with God's will rather than bending God's will to ours. The LORD will be with you; do not be afraid.
Pray without ceasing, in all circumstances, with thanksgiving. Choose life, that you and your descendants may live.
Prayer is both a duty and a privilege, a lifeline to the divine. Be strong and courageous, for the LORD goes with you.
purpose: Hear, O Israel: Your purpose is to know God and to make Him known. May you always follow the LORD's commands.
Thus says the LORD: God has created you for good works, prepared beforehand. Keep these words in your heart.
As God commanded, Seek first the kingdom of God, and all these things will be added to you. The LORD will be with you; do not be afraid.
Your life is a testimony to God's faithfulness and love. Choose life, that you and your descendants may live.
In serving others, you fulfill part of your divine purpose. Be strong and courageous, for the LORD goes with you.
faith: Hear, O Israel: Faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen. May you always follow the LORD's commands.
Thus says the LORD: Faith grows through testing, like gold refined by fire. Keep these words in your heart.
As God commanded, Walk by faith, not by sight, trusting God's promises. The LORD will be with you; do not be afraid.
Faith is a journey of trust, with steps both certain and uncertain. Choose life, that you and your descendants may live.
Without faith it is impossible to please God, for whoever would draw near to Him must believe that He exists and rewards those who seek Him. Be strong and courageous, for the LORD goes with you.

law: These commandments that I give you today are to be on your hearts.
Keep the decrees and laws that I am setting before you today, so that you may live.
Be careful to follow every command I am giving you today, so that you may live and increase.
Do not add to what I command you and do not subtract from it, but keep the commands of the LORD your God.
The LORD is our God, the LORD alone. Love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength.
exodus: The LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, with great terror and with signs and wonders.
Remember this day in which you came out from Egypt, out of the house of slavery, for by a strong hand the LORD brought you out from this place.
I have seen the affliction of my people, and have heard their cry, and I have come down to deliver them.
The LORD will fight for you; you need only to be still.
By faith we passed through the Red Sea as on dry land; but when the Egyptians tried to do so, they were drowned.
leadership: Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh and bring the children of Israel out of Egypt?
O Lord, I have never been eloquent, neither in the past nor since you have spoken to your servant.
The LORD your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among you, from your brothers—it is to him you shall listen.
Teach these things to your children and to their children after them.
Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the LORD your God goes with you; he will never leave you nor forsake you.

Jesus: Consider what is in your heart as you ask this.
The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand. Seek first His righteousness.
My Father is still working, and I am working.
What does the Scripture say about this matter?
Let your faith guide you in this question.
Paul: In all things, seek to glorify God and edify one another.
Test everything; hold fast what is good.
Let us walk by the Spirit, and not gratify the desires of the flesh.
Whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is commendable—think about these things.
I do not claim to have all wisdom, but I share what has been revealed to me.
Moses: Remember the LORD your God and keep His commandments.
The LORD will guide you if you seek His will.
Consider the history of God's faithfulness to His people.
These matters should be approached with reverence for the LORD.
Look to the Law that the LORD has given for guidance.
